page.title: 16RECREATION
page.content: Camer Park, once privately owned, is open to the public. It is very popular with families and dog_owners.It is approximately 3O km2. There is a large car park, an extensive area of grass and a wide variety of trees, many named.There are swings, a slide and a climbing frame. There are few restrictions and little vandalism. Meopham Green is a level triangular area of grass with a club house, used by the Cricket Club. At Meopham, and at Henley Street, there are recreation grounds with slides, see_saws and swings. There are village halls at Sole Street and Meopham, used by clubs most evenings.The Secondary School provides facilities for clubs and evening classes attended by all age groups.
